NEAR plans to develop user-owned AI applications as part of a strategic AI roadmap spanning the next 3-6 months. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAlso, we have been sponsoring hackathons with AI bounties to challenge hackers to integrate Chain Abstraction into AI projects. Check @NEARDevhub X\\\\\\'s (former Twitter) account for more information about the winners. Also, we recommend watching Illia\\\\\\'s video regarding his vision for AI and NEAR\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jt4ja2PuZ4Q\\\\\\\\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nZQPA1IQhX0\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Introduction \\\\u{1f929} "}, {"id": "im9vze", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Videos \\\\u{1f4f9}"}, {"id": "gwkell", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Technical Resources \\\\u{1f4da}"}, {"id": "n4evln", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Community calls \\\\u{1f4de}"}], "admins": ["flmel.near"], "handle": "ai-community", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihgxkxuvj67b7vwys5di2326vx7sdvw5jjswv2xqlyxhelhha52ra", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreicsqoq765kdfi4waqn4e6jldjvjw2nppvhhavgf2tac4ftplnd2dm", "description": "Community Group focused on AI research and development", "website_url": null, "bio_markdown": "Under Construction, we\\\\\\'ll be ready soon!", "github_handle": null, "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": null}}

{"data": {"devhub.near": {"widget": {"devhub.entity.addon.blogv2.editor.provider": {"": "const { getPost, setCommunitySocialDB } = VM.require(\\\\n  \\\\\\\"devhub.near/widget/core.adapter.devhub-contract\\\\\\\"\\\\n);\\\\n\\\\nconst { generateRandom6CharUUID } = VM.require(\\\\n  \\\\\\\"devhub.near/widget/core.lib.stringUtils\\\\\\\"\\\\n);\\\\n\\\\ngenerateRandom6CharUUID || (generateRandom6CharUUID = () => {});\\\\n\\\\nconst { Layout, handle, communityAddonId } = props;\\\\n\\\\nsetCommunitySocialDB = setCommunitySocialDB || (() => <></>);\\\\ngetPost = getPost || (() => <></>);\\\\n\\\\nconst handleGetData = (v) => {\\\\n  const id = transformString(v.title);\\\\n  return blogData[id] || {};\\\\n};\\\\n\\\\nconst [blogData, setBlogData] = useState([]);\\\\n\\\\nconst initialBlogData =\\\\n  Social.get([`${handle}.community.devhub.near/blog/**`], \\\\\\\"final\\\\\\\") || {};\\\\n\\\\nuseEffect(() => {\\\\n  if (initialBlogData) {\\\\n    setBlogData(initialBlogData);\\\\n  }\\\\n}, [initialBlogData]);\\\\n\\\\nfunction publishedBlogsOfThisInstance(blogsObject) {\\\\n  if (!blogsObject) return [];\\\\n  return (\\\\n    Object.keys(blogsObject)\\\\n      .map((key) => {\\\\n        return {\\\\n          ...blogsObject[key].metadata,\\\\n          id: key,\\\\n          content: blogsObject[key][\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\"],\\\\n        };\\\\n      })\\\\n      // Show only published blogs\\\\n      .filter((blog) => blog.status === \\\\\\\"PUBLISH\\\\\\\")\\\\n      // Every instance of the blog tab has its own blogs\\\\n      .filter((blog) => blog.communityAddonId === communityAddonId)\\\\n  );\\\\n}\\\\n\\\\nfunction checkHashes() {\\\\n  if (transactionHashes) {\\\\n    // Fetch new blog data\\\\n    const subscribeToBlogForNextFifteenSec = (tries) => {\\\\n      if (tries >= 5) {\\\\n        return;\\\\n      }\\\\n      Near.asyncView(\\\\\\\"social.near\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"get\\\\\\\", {\\\\n        keys: [`${handle}.community.devhub.near/blog/**`],\\\\n      }).then((result) => {\\\\n        try {\\\\n          const newBlogPosts = result[`${handle}.community.devhub.near`].blog;\\\\n          // Check the number of blogs in this instance with a different status\\\\n          if (\\\\n            publishedBlogsOfThisInstance(newBlogPosts).length !==\\\\n            publishedBlogsOfThisInstance(blogData).length\\\\n          ) {\\\\n            setBlogData(newBlogPosts);\\\\n          } else {\\\\n            setTimeout(() => {\\\\n              subscribeToBlogForNextFifteenSec(tries + 1);\\\\n            }, 3000);\\\\n          }\\\\n        } catch (e) {}\\\\n      });\\\\n    };\\\\n    // After a second subscribe to the blog data\\\\n    setTimeout(() => {\\\\n      subscribeToBlogForNextFifteenSec(0);\\\\n    }, 1000);\\\\n  }\\\\n}\\\\n\\\\nuseEffect(() => {\\\\n  // Only render one time\\\\n  checkHashes();\\\\n}, []);\\\\n\\\\n// Show only published blogs\\\\nconst processedData = Object.keys(blogData)\\\\n  .map((key) => {\\\\n    return {\\\\n      ...blogData[key].metadata,\\\\n      id: key,\\\\n      content: blogData[key][\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\"],\\\\n    };\\\\n  })\\\\n  // Every instance of the blog tab has its own blogs\\\\n  .filter((blog) => blog.communityAddonId === communityAddonId)\\\\n  // Sort by published date\\\\n  .sort((blog1, blog2) => {\\\\n    if (data.orderBy === \\\\\\\"timeasc\\\\\\\") {\\\\n      return new Date(blog1.publishedAt) - new Date(blog2.publishedAt);\\\\n    }\\\\n    if (data.orderBy === \\\\\\\"alpha\\\\\\\") {\\\\n      return (blog1.title || \\\\\\\"\\\\\\\").localeCompare(blog2.title || \\\\\\\"\\\\\\\");\\\\n    }\\\\n    // timedesc is the default order\\\\n    return new Date(blog2.publishedAt) - new Date(blog1.publishedAt);\\\\n  });\\\\n\\\\nfunction transformString(str) {\\\\n  // Convert the string to lowercase\\\\n  const lowerCaseStr = str.toLowerCase();\\\\n\\\\n  // Replace spaces with hyphens\\\\n  const transformedStr = lowerCaseStr.replace(/ /g, \\\\\\\"-\\\\\\\");\\\\n\\\\n  // Replace anything that is not a letter or a number with an empty string\\\\n  const cleanedStr = transformedStr.replace(/[^a-z0-9A-Z-]/g, \\\\\\\"\\\\\\\");\\\\n\\\\n  // Return the transformed string\\\\n  return cleanedStr;\\\\n}\\\\n\\\\nconst handleOnSubmit = (v, isEdit) => {\\\\n  let id = isEdit\\\\n    ? v.id\\\\n    : `${transformString(v.title)}-${generateRandom6CharUUID()}`;\\\\n  let publishedAt = new Date(v.date).toISOString().slice(0, 10);\\\\n\\\\n  let metadata = {\\\\n    title: v.title,\\\\n    publishedAt,\\\\n    status: v.status,\\\\n    subtitle: v.subtitle,\\\\n    description: v.description,\\\\n    author: v.author,\\\\n    category: v.category,\\\\n    updatedAt: new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 10),\\\\n  };\\\\n\\\\n  if (!isEdit) {\\\\n    // Set this once when created\\\\n    metadata.createdAt = new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 10);\\\\n    metadata.communityAddonId = communityAddonId;\\\\n  }\\\\n\\\\n  setCommunitySocialDB({\\\\n    handle,\\\\n    data: {\\\\n      blog: {\\\\n        [id]: {\\\\n          \\\\\\\"\\\\\\\": v.content,\\\\n          metadata,\\\\n        },\\\\n      },\\\\n    },\\\\n  });\\\\n};\\\\n\\\\nconst handleOnDelete = (id) => {\\\\n  setCommunitySocialDB({\\\\n    handle,\\\\n    data: {\\\\n      blog: {\\\\n        [id]: {\\\\n          \\\\\\\"\\\\\\\": null,\\\\n          metadata: {\\\\n            title: null,\\\\n            createdAt: null,\\\\n            updatedAt: null,\\\\n            publishedAt: null,\\\\n            status: null,\\\\n            subtitle: null,\\\\n            description: null,\\\\n            author: null,\\\\n            id: null,\\\\n            category: null,\\\\n            communityAddonId: null,\\\\n          },\\\\n        },\\\\n      },\\\\n    },\\\\n  });\\\\n};\\\\n\\\\nreturn (\\\\n  <Layout\\\\n    data={processedData || []}\\\\n    getData={handleGetData}\\\\n    onSubmit={handleOnSubmit}\\\\n    onDelete={handleOnDelete}\\\\n  />\\\\n);\\\\n"}}}}}

{"handle": "ai-community", "community": {"tag": "ai-community", "name": "NEAR AI Community Group", "addons": [{"id": "announcements", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "announcements", "parameters": "", "display_name": "Announcements"}, {"id": "discussions", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "discussions", "parameters": "", "display_name": "Discussions"}, {"id": "r60pcq", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "activity", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Activity"}, {"id": "sai165", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"NEAR AI\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"NEAR Protocol is advancing its technological framework by integrating artificial intelligence into its stack. NEAR plans to develop user-owned AI applications as part of a strategic AI roadmap spanning the next 3-6 months. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nAlso, we have been sponsoring hackathons with AI bounties to challenge hackers to integrate Chain Abstraction into AI projects. Check @NEARDevhub X\\\\\\'s (former Twitter) account for more information about the winners. Also, we recommend watching Illia\\\\\\'s video regarding his vision for AI and NEAR\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jt4ja2PuZ4Q\\\\\\\\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nZQPA1IQhX0\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Introduction \\\\u{1f929} "}, {"id": "im9vze", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Videos \\\\u{1f4f9}"}, {"id": "gwkell", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Technical Resources \\\\u{1f4da}"}, {"id": "n4evln", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Community calls \\\\u{1f4de}"}], "admins": ["flmel.near", "orangejoe.near"], "handle": "ai-community", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihgxkxuvj67b7vwys5di2326vx7sdvw5jjswv2xqlyxhelhha52ra", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreicsqoq765kdfi4waqn4e6jldjvjw2nppvhhavgf2tac4ftplnd2dm", "description": "Community Group focused on AI research and development", "website_url": null, "bio_markdown": "Under Construction, we\\\\\\'ll be ready soon!", "github_handle": null, "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": null}}

{"data": {"blog": {"hackathon-resources-for-redacted-lsy0pp": {"": "We\\\\\\'re excited to have you build on NEAR and compete in the [REDACTED] hackathon.  \\\\n\\\\nAt DevHub, we are providing a list of resources to get started with NEAR technology and how to get help. \\\\n\\\\n*This is a living document and will get updated over time.*\\\\n\\\\nLive DevRel and Community Support:\\\\n- NEAR Dev Support Channels (Telegram): https://t.me/neardev\\\\n- DevHub Announcements: https://t.me/NEARDevHub\\\\n\\\\nCompletely new to NEAR: \\\\n- https://docs.near.org/concepts/basics/protocol\\\\n- https://docs.near.org/concepts/protocol/account-model\\\\n\\\\nTutorials: https://docs.near.org/tutorials/welcome\\\\n\\\\nSmart Contracts:\\\\n- https://docs.near.org/build/smart-contracts/quickstart\\\\n- https://docs.near.org/build/smart-contracts/what-is\\\\n\\\\nFrontend Development:\\\\n- https://docs.near.org/build/web3-apps/quickstart\\\\n\\\\nChain Abstraction:\\\\n- https://docs.near.org/build/chain-abstraction/chain-signatures\\\\n- https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures (All about Chain Signatures)\\\\n\\\\nAI:\\\\n- https://near.ai/\\\\n\\\\nAlong with these resources we have a newsletter (https://bit.ly/devhubnews) and do a weekly live show, DevHub Live, and WuASM (Wake Up & Ship More, which does not have a set schedule yet).\\\\n\\\\nOur entire video archive, which includes all live streams and community call replays are available on our [YouTube](https://youtube.com/@NEARDevHub).\\\\n\\\\nLastly, please also make sure to check out our socials to keep up to date on everything developer centric on NEAR.\\\\n[YouTube](https://youtube.com/@NEARDevHub)\\\\n[Twitch](https://twitch.tv/neardevhub)\\\\n[X](https://x.com/neardevhub)\\\\n[IG](https://instagram.com/neardevhub)\\\\n[TikTok](https://tiktok.com/@neardevhub)\\\\n[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/near-devhub)\\\\n[Threads](https://www.threads.net/@neardevhub)\\\\n[Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/user/NEARDevHub)\\\\n", "metadata": {"title": "Hackathon Resources for REDACTED", "author": "orangejoe.near", "status": "PUBLISH", "category": "reference", "subtitle": "Quick links to get started with your project", "updatedAt": "2024-08-16", "description": "Quick links to help get started with your hackathon project.", "publishedAt": "2024-08-10"}}}}, "handle": "developer-dao"}

Ship More, which does not have a set schedule yet).\\\\n\\\\nOur entire video archive, which includes all live streams and community call replays are available on our {"body": {"name": "DevHub Developer Contributor report by Peter for 2024-07-20 - 2024-08-18", "summary": "Requesting funding for my DevHub contributions in the period 20th of July to 18th of August 2024. 47 hours in total. \\\\n\\\\nWorked on the main DevHub repository release pipelines for infrastructure/events committee. Created share clean URL links for community announcements. Fixed a bug in BOS-CLI asking for storage deposit when not needed. Setup of test gateway for reusing components across instances. Tests for the Treasury dashboard, and analytics for docs/dev.near.org.", "category": "DevDAO Platform", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "Below is a log of the time spent for various tasks. As usual I am asking for the compensation rate of $150 per hour, which I consider the rate for a senior developer/architect in Norway, also then taking into account expenses of self employment.\\\\n\\\\n| Date | Amount | Task | Issue/PR | Description |\\\\n| ---------- | ------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |\\\\n| 2024-07-20 | 3 | Release infra/events from devhub repo | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/890](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/890) | Assistance and review of PR for setting up github actions to release events and infrastructure committee instances from the main devhub repo. Deployment scripts turned to overwrite devhub.near.. Need to ensure a proper dry-run. Delete existing devhub components |\\\\n| 2024-07-21 | 2 | Fix broken devhub deployment | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/894](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/894) | Try deploying just a few widgets instead of everything. Found that bos-cli gives the error message about insufficient storage regardless of plenty of available storage. Use of bos-cli-rs instead of bos components deploy, and a script that creates the component arguments json, and deploy by calling social.near/set using bos-cli-rs. |\\\\n| 2024-07-23 | 0,5 | Broken devhub deployment | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/897](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/897) | Created issue, checked with bos-cli and see that we are using an old version |\\\\n| 2024-07-24 | 0,5 | Release infra/events from devhub repo | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/902](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/902) | Testing of possibilities with dry-run when environments are protected, and suggesting separate workflow files for dry-run vs deploy |\\\\n| 2024-07-24 | 0,5 | Sync | | Weekly sync |\\\\n| 2024-07-24 | 1,5 | Release infra/events from devhub repo | https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/902, https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/903 | Call with Megha, going carefully through the deployment of infra and events from main devhub repository. First merged a commit with just displaying the deploy transaction, and after we changed to \\\\\\\"send\\\\\\\". Also discussing the issue on the workflow run from saturday where the environment is set, but the script variables are not populated ( [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/actions/runs/10023216203/job/27703863731](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/actions/runs/10023216203/job/27703863731) ), which we found depends on if the branch to be merged is from a fork or from the main repo. |\\\\n| 2024-07-25 | 1 | Community announcement clean URL sharing | https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/908 ( https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/907 ) | Playwright test for share link for community announcement, copy feed/post components from near into devhub to change share URL |\\\\n| 2024-07-26 | 1 | Community announcement clean URL sharing | https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/908 ( https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/907 ) | Handle direct links to the post widget, troubleshooting indexers where no queries seem to work |\\\\n| 2024-07-27 | 3 | Community announcement clean URL sharing | https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/908 ( https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/907 ) | Fix and test for fallback to social index (because of lag between indexer reported blockheight and social index reported blockheight ) should use the post component with clean URL sharing. Support scrolling linked announcement into the view, and also add waiting for elements to be loaded ( for all loading indicators to be done ) before scrolling |\\\\n| 2024-07-28 | 1 | Community announcement clean URL sharing | https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/908 ( https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/907 ) | Separate script file for scrolling posts into view, that can also be referenced by the contract. |\\\\n| 2024-07-29 | 4 | Broken devhub deployment | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/897](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/897) | Debugging of BOS-CLI storage estimation. Getting to know BOS-CLI and found that the storage estimation is in the near-socialdb-cli. Various test cases on storage estimation to understand how it works ( [https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/11](https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/11) ). Test with locally compiled BOS-cli on the same devhub deployment says zero required deposit, and does not confirm the issue we see in the pipeline. In the end, found that public keys for deployment needs to have write permission, even if they belong to the target social db account ( devhub.near in this case ). Saw that a new public key was introduced, which does not have write permission in socialdb. |\\\\n| 2024-07-30 | 3 | Broken devhub deployment | [https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/11](https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/11) | Unit tests for reproducing the issue of writing with function access keys that does not have explicit write permission, but belongs to the account we want to write to in socialdb. Additional unit tests for other scenarios. Fix the issue, and update codestyle pipeline to use latest ubuntu and rust cache because of compilation errors. |\\\\n| 2024-07-31 | 1,5 | Sync | | Weekly sync and walkthrough and discussions on the Treasury app |\\\\n| 2024-07-31 | 1 | Community announcement clean URL sharing | https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/908 ( https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/907 ) | Highlight linked announcement, just like linked proposal comments |\\\\n| 2024-07-31 | 0,5 | Review | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/912](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/912) | Review of using common proposal feed component for all instances. Feedback on considering running the same feed tests for all 3 current instances. |\\\\n| 2024-08-02 | 3 | Test gateway for all instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/914
https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/913](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/914https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/913) | Use BOS workspace as a gateway for hosting all instances at once. In tests: replace all references to http://localhost:2000 with MOCK_RPC_URL. remove modifySocialNearGetRPCResponsesInsteadOfGettingWidgetsFromBOSLoader ( not needed when RPC proxy handles this ). mock RPC request must check on path, would not work on origin. Increase timeouts in waiting for scrolling into view and comments to appear, since this is needed when cadhe is not populated. |\\\\n| 2024-08-03 | 3 | Test gateway for all instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/914
https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/913](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/914https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/913) | Github configurator test failed, and found that without cache, don\\\\\\'t use empty functions when waiting for vm.require, rather wait for them to be loaded.
The github addon configurator test was suddenly struggling when not having an RPC cache, and this can be seen in the live instance also. There is no \\\\\\\"Board\\\\\\\" section, which is again because the board state columns are not populated when having to wait for required widgets to load ( VM.require ). Functions loaded with VM.require should not be set to empty functions while waiting for load, but rather the component should return and show a loading indicator. This is especially the case when using VM.require functions to set initial state.
wait for label options to be available in old sunset tests. |\\\\n| 2024-08-04 | 0,5 | Test gateway for all instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/914

Tests for the Treasury dashboard, and analytics for docs/dev.near.org.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=182)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

Added env variables to build .yml |\\\\n| 2024-08-17 | 0,5 | Treasury dashboard test infrastructure and payment request tests | | Call with Megha about remaining issues: clearing the payment request form, transaction history with balance ( use nearblocks activities API ) and canceling transactions from the confirmation modal (suggesting a toast asking the user to confirm if the transaction was cancelled, which might also be useful for wallets like meteor) |\\\\n| 2024-08-17 | 2 | Treasury dashboard web4 | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-treasury-dashboard/pull/43](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-treasury-dashboard/pull/43) | Initial setup of web4 deployment for treasury dashboard using minimumweb4 contract from JsInRust. Support login with walletselector. |\\\\n| 2024-08-18 | 2 | Treasury dashboard analytics | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-treasury-dashboard/pull/43](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-treasury-dashboard/pull/43) | Release setup for the minimum_weg4.wasm contract ( https://github.com/petersalomonsen/quickjs-rust-near/pull/17 ), and setup of posthog analytics. |\\\\n| 2024-08-18 | 0,5 | BOS CLI | [https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/bos-cli-rs/pull/99](https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/bos-cli-rs/pull/99) | devcontainer (codespaces) setup and update of near-socialdb-client to 0.3.2 |\\\\n| | | | | |\\\\n| | | | |\\\\n\\\\nTotal hours: 47\\\\nHourly rate (USD): $150\\\\nTotal requested amount (USD): 7050", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "petersalomonsen.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "7050", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "petersalomonsen.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "DevHub Activities Report 8/5-8/18", "summary": "DevHub Moderator Contributions Bi-Weekly Report", "category": "DevDAO Operations", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "**DevHub Activities**\\\\n- Newsletter review and distribution \\\\n\\\\t- Reviewed new design\\\\n\\\\t- Wrote and deployed  new email welcome flow for new signups to newsletter\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- 2 steps\\\\n- Workgroup support\\\\n\\\\t- Marketing\\\\n- Ecosystem updates\\\\n\\\\t- Collect info, created slides, and presented/posted rundown in channel\\\\n\\\\t- Planning for future updates on a regular schedule\\\\n\\\\n**DevRel:**\\\\n- Internal Meetings: weekly stand-ups, 1-on-1 with team members, and meetings with core team members.\\\\n- Ecosystem developer conversations and feedback collection for current and future initiatives\\\\n\\\\t- Developer follow-up online\\\\n- Ambassador program draft updates for developers\\\\n- Outreach to help coordinate revamp of AI builders groups\\\\n- Developer outreach\\\\n\\\\t- Remote support for NEAR ecosystem projects\\\\n- Meetings with teams like HZN and marketing\\\\n\\\\t- Planning with teams during current cohort\\\\n\\\\t- Outreach and support\\\\n\\\\n**Marketing & Retention Planning & In-Progress:**\\\\n* Social Media posts\\\\n\\\\t* Summary- 83k+ impressions, 1.8K interactions, 49 total posts (across all) \\\\n- Social content planning\\\\n\\\\t- Restarted LinkedIn account\\\\n\\\\t- Started Threads account\\\\n\\\\t- Livestream planning, setup, and recording\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- 6 Episodes - 2.75k+ impressions (includes replays)\\\\n\\\\t- Video planning and scripting\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- Planning for upcoming episodes\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- Working on CTAs for content\\\\n\\\\t* Video recordings\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t* 2 DevHub Lives\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t* 4 WuASMS\\\\n\\\\t* Clips editing\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t* 18 unique clips produced -> 80 posts -> 30K+ views\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t* Custom edits for new social channels\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t* Content copy and scheduling of clips across 4+ social media channels\\\\n- Content coordination\\\\n\\\\t- Planning regarding new concepts for Live Stream (coding segments)\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- Working on custom content plan for \\\\n\\\\t- Link updates \\\\n\\\\t\\\\t- Started updating links to the new DevHub URL parameters for better tracking\\\\n\\\\t* Coordination with NF, Pagoda, and 3rd parties for upcoming content items\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t* Redacted hackathon content brief reviews\\\\n\\\\t\\\\t* Planing time and recording for Redacted and collab with NF live streams\\\\n\\\\n**Reimbursements:**\\\\n* streamyard - 49\\\\n* opus -38\\\\n* twitter - 8\\\\n* video licenses - 28\\\\n* webflow - 19\\\\n\\\\n**Timeline**\\\\n\\\\n- Start Date: 8/5/2024\\\\n- End Date: 8/18/2024\\\\n\\\\n**Requested Funding**\\\\n\\\\n- Total hours: 80\\\\n- Rate: $100/hour\\\\n- Total amount: $8142 USDC", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "joespano.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "8142", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": [], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 126123206}
